abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Global Environment
            Facility (GEF) Renewable Energy Resources Project is to help
            develop an economically and environmentally sustainable
            market for renewable energy resources in Croatia.
            Development of this market will support Croatia in its
            European Union (EU) accession efforts. Under the level two
            restructuring, no changes are proposed to the project's
            development objectives, outcomes, design, or scope. The
            restructuring proposes only an extension of the grant's
            closing date to enable signing of already prepared contracts
            under component one (contingent loan facility) and related
            disbursements under component two (contingent loan
            facility). Currently, 45.66 percent of the grant has been
            disbursed, and with a two-month extension of the project
            closing date the final disbursement is expected to reach 65
            percent. The remaining undisbursed funds will be canceled.
            One of the main reasons why the project will not reach full
            disbursement is related to delays during the project's
            initial stages due to the late adoption of secondary
            legislation that established feed-in tariffs for renewable
            energy, licensing, and permit procedures--a prerequisite for
            the launch of the project's second component and an
            important precondition for the development of a renewable
            energy market. The legislation was finally adopted in July 2007.
